intro: Spicanta onocleoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling herb with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in prairies, roadsides, and sandy areas. Due to its adaptive traits, it is considered a resilient species in harsh environments.
